title: Cat. 62  Man with an Ax, 1893/94
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
incorrect section number 14055 <section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Man with an Ax  
1893/94  
Pen and black ink, and brush and black wash, with pen and brown ink (originally purple, est.) and touches of graphite, on heavily textured ivory wove paper; 351 × 251 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, 2012.81  
For the verso, see fig. 62.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Sold at Sotheby’s, London, Apr. 24, 1963, lot 17, to Robert M. Light (born 1929) for Dorothy Braude Edinburg, (1921–2015), Brookline, Mass., July 12, 1963.

Given by Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2012.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Gauguin Tahiti, Feb. 29–June 20, 2004, not in cat.

Art Institute of Chicago, Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master through Modern; The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, June 3–July 30, 2006, cat. 64 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Charles Morice, Paul Gauguin (H. Floury, 1919), p. 128 (ill.).

John Rewald, Gauguin (Hyperion, 1938), p. 114 (ill.).

Georges Wildenstein, Gauguin, with Raymond Cogniat and Daniel Wildenstein, vol. 1, Catalogue (Beaux-Arts, 1964), pp. 169, 195, under cat. 430 and 484.

Art Institute of Chicago, Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master through Modern; The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, ed. Suzanne Folds McCullagh, with contributions by Douglas D. Druick, Brandon Ruud, et al., exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago/Yale University Press, 2006), p. 99, cat. 64 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Inscribed lower right, in graphite: 2

Collector’s stamp lower right, in black ink: COLLECTION / D B E / COLLECTION

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Invoice from R. M. Light & Co., Inc., Boston and Scottsdale, Arizona, to Mrs. Joseph Edingburg [sic], July 12, 1963. Dorothy Braude Edinburg’s stamp (COLLECTION / DBE / COLLECTION; not in Lugt) is stamped on the verso, lower right, in black.

According to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, correspondence, Feb. 26, 2004, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

Reprinted as Charles Morice, Paul Gauguin (H. Floury, 1920), p. 140 (ill.).

Collector’s stamp of Dorothy Braude Edinburg (not in Lugt).

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 62 Man with an Ax, 1893/94.

fig. 62.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Man with an Ax (1893/94). The Art Institute of Chicago, 2012.81.

</section>
